SENT.plain: Because of a suspected association between the drug oxymetholone and abnormal glucose metabolism, we determined immunoreactive insulin (IRI) and plasma glucose during oral glucose tolerance testing in seven patients with aplastic anemia, six of whom received oxymetholone therapy
All patients receiving oxymetholone therapy had abnormal glucose and/or IRI values
This finding was independent of GH, cortisol, and glucagon
In one patient, glucose and IRI levels were normal before oxymetholone but became abnormally elevated after the use of this drug
Furthermore, normal glucose and IRI values were present in the single patient not receiving oxymetholone
Thus, a positive relationship was demonstrated between oxymetholone administration and the presence of glucose intolerance and insulin resistance
